summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from June 2020 requesting volunteer agents to assist with a 'taint review' in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The email highlights the high-profile nature of the case and the involvement of the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the high-profile investigation for which the FBI is conducting a taint review.

connections.description: N. forwards an email chain to M. and others, showing they are FBI colleagues coordinating on the Epstein case taint review.
N. is an FBI agent involved in the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein, as indicated by the request for taint review assistance.

events.title: Initial Taint Review Request
events.description: An FBI Special Agent emails M. requesting assistance for a taint review related to the Jeffrey Epstein case.

events.title: Taint Review Volunteers Confirmed
events.description: N. confirms that three agents have volunteered to assist with the taint review for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively conducting a 'taint review' in the Jeffrey Epstein case as of June 2020, indicating ongoing investigative or pre-trial evidence processing.
The request for assistance came from Squad C-2, identified as the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit in New York.
The email describes the Epstein investigation as a 'high profile investigation' and a 'unique opportunity' for agents.
Three FBI agents had volunteered to assist with the taint review by June 18, 2020.
